meanings.definition: To run naked in a public place.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I saw a person streaking across the park.
meanings.sent2: The news reported an incident of streaking at the football game.
meanings.sent3: The streaking runner caused quite a stir among the spectators.
meanings.sent4: Her bold act of streaking painted a vivid image in everyone's minds.
meanings.sent5: The streaking incident will be remembered for a long time.

meanings.definition: To move quickly in a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The car was streaking down the highway at top speed.
meanings.sent2: The shooting star was streaking across the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The streaking comet was a sight to behold for the astronomers.
meanings.sent4: His words were streaking through the room, leaving an impact on everyone.
meanings.sent5: The streaking bullet hit the target with precision.

meanings.definition: A brief run of luck or success.
meanings.sent1: She experienced a streaking of wins in the tennis tournament.
meanings.sent2: The team's streaking of victories boosted their morale.
meanings.sent3: His streaking of luck at the casino made him smile from ear to ear.
meanings.sent4: The company's streaking of profits surprised everyone in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The streaking of good fortune seemed never-ending for him.
